snippet.title: Showdown 43: Pride, prejudice, destiny
snippet.content:
NOT since the "Ultimate Showdown" - their semi-final encounter almost 12 years ago - has an Adelaide Crows v Port Adelaide clash carried so much significance. Adelaide, sitting top of the ladder, is aiming for a fifth consecutive Showdown victory, which would give it the lead on the head-to-head ledger, currently tied at 21-21. More importantly, a win will take the Crows a step closer to a coveted top-two finish and a home qualifying final for the first time in five seasons. Port Adelaide, meanwhile, will be looking to thrive on its underdog status as it chases a top-four spot and the double chance. The two sides have not played finals in the same season since 2007, when the Power went all the way to the Grand Final, only to lose to Geelong by 119 points. More than 50,000 fans are expected to brave the wet and windy conditions for today's crunch match, which starts at 4.10pm. The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting the possibility of a thunderstorm and hail in the afternoon, possible heavy rainfall, and a maximum temperature of just 13C. Fans are urged to allow an extra 20 minutes to enter Adelaide Oval, where enhanced security inspections will be implemented in the wake of a flare being set off at the venue last month. The Crows and Power will be hoping to avoid the off-field unpleasantness that has plagued the past two matches and earlier this season led to both clubs taking a united stance against racism. Supporters from both sides will continue to speculate over the fitness of star small forward and Showdown specialist Eddie Betts, who had his appendix removed just 14 days ago, until Adelaide announces its final 22 an hour-and-a-half before the bounce. There also will be anticipation over which Port player will tag Rory Sloane - the Showdown medallist the last time these two teams met in round three when the Crows won by 17 points. The battle lines are drawn, the time for talking is over. Who will be triumphant? It should be an epic game. ARE YOU A SHOWDOWN SPECIALIST?
